grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 沸々【フツフツ】simmer, bubble out, flow out
沸々【フツフツ】simmer, bubble out, flow out
kun reading compounds: 沸く【わく】to grow hot (e.g. water), to boil, to get excited (at), to erupt (in applause, cheering, etc.), to be in a ferment, to take place energetically, to ferment, to melt (of metal)
沸かす【わかす】to boil, to heat, to excite, to melt (metal)
